caption.p: Epidemiology of acute Viral Hepatitis B

tr.td: Hepatitis B virus (HBV) a hepadnavirus, partially double-stranded DNA virus
Jaundice (70%), fatigue, abdominal pain, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, joint pain (30% have no signs or symptoms)

Overall: trend declining (81% since 1990); 1.6 per 100,000; Race/ethnicity highest among blacks: 2.3 per 100,000; Highest age group: 25–44 years (3.1 per 100,000); Highest rates in the South; Male to female ratio 1.8:1
40% of cases hospitalized; 0.8% died; increased rate of hospitalization with increasing age
Infected blood or blood products or any other body fluids containing blood or unfixed tissues or organs
• Men who have sex with men
• Diagnosis of a sexually transmitted disease
• Individuals having sex with multiple partners
• Household contacts of chronically infected persons

• Infants/children of immigrants from areas with high rates of HBV infection (Southeast Asia, China, Korea, Indonesia, and the Philippines; the Middle East, except Israel; South and Western Pacific islands; the interior Amazon River basin; Haiti and the Dominican Republic)
• Health care and public safety workers with exposure to blood
